channel.title: The blocked number
channel.description: Wepl this number "blocked" keeps calling me 1 or twice a day. And I'm on the phone with it right now and no ones talking and I keep yelling but no ones talking. I don't really hear anything. But very light static. And then I heard tapping kind of like a horse galloping sound. It's Been about 10 minutes. Anyways anyone know how I can call back or find out the number of the person or thing that's. Calling me? Thanks

item.title: The blocked number
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:17, topic:431371”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=534049.msg3904308#msg3904308 date=1328063506]
I saw something on one of those TV stations where they only show kidnappings and murders. This lady kept getting calls like you were, but the person would call her 5 to 6 times a day, and this went on for 7 years or so. He called her when she moved houses. He called her hotel room when she would travel. He knew everything about her. And the police didn’t do anything about it until he left a voicemail saying he was going to kill her. Then she found out it was her neighbor and he killed himself.

tl;dr version: Get it taken care of before your driven crazy and attempted to be killed.
[/quote]
That’s a little over speculation for a few phone calls. 0.o[/quote]

nou

Read full topic

item.title: The blocked number
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:20, topic:431371”][quote author=Dunder Mifflin link=topic=534049.msg3904324#msg3904324 date=1328064579]

Fail trolling. If your gonna troll be good at it. Thanks for serious responses

Stop copying what you said, and i’m being serious about if your door, is unlocked or not
and check your windows
That call could be a call to check if the owner is home or not, or if someone is home is a child

I’m on my iPhone and when I opened safari it probably refreshed and posted again. Stop juumping to ignorant conclusions.
[/quote]
It’s not being ignorant, I’m just saying, just making sure you don’t make duplicate posts[/quote]
Happened to me back when I had an HTC Hero, just saying.

Read full topic

item.title: The blocked number
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Get a new phone number, more then likely it’s a friend messing with you so if this were me I’d make a status on Facebook about it and the person who’s doing it will be so happy he’s getting the attention he wants he’ll come right out with it.
Seriously.

Read full topic

item.title: The blocked number
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Call your phone company and they will block the number for you, but don’t really worry about it, someone probably posted your number on 4chan. Someone posted mine on there and I had a lot of blocked numbers calling me till I changed my voice mail to a ripped version of the white houses main public phone line.

Read full topic

item.title: The blocked number

item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

-eDIT-:

call 911 or swat and say that someone is planning to create a terrorist attack somewhere and then tell swat that the terrorist will call you in 2 days to see if you have delivered the explosive to a abandoned garage… if the phone for some reason rings on the day you tell them then the fbi can track the number and see were its coming from ps. make sure to make up a legitimate story why you think there will be a terrorist attack… like it was probaly some1 prank calling you for laughs for the past 3 days

lololosloolsdodl…no.
